result.execSummary:
The defendant Rickey J Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, BY 10-01-2016. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence; release for inmate work assignments, and The Day Reporting Center (if eligible); with credit for 5 days (01-23-2015 to 01-27-2015) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
*3/2/2016  Request for electronic monitoring denied.  Request for additional privileges granted.  May be released for the following in addition to release privileges granted at sentencing on 9/21/2015: work and work search.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Fine is set at ZERO.
Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rickey J Harris

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: AMENDED

Order, signed and filed. tk
The defendant's request for release on electronic monitoring is denied as it would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense, render the House Of Correction time meaningless and frustrate the court's specific sentencing intent.
The defendant's request for additional privileges is granted. Defendant may be released for the following, in addition to release privileges granted at sentencing on 09-21-2015,  Work and Work Search. 
Copies mailed to parties.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rickey J Harris in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Rickey J Harris in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 2 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 10 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; release for inmate work assignments, and The Day Reporting Center (if eligible); with credit for 5 days (01-23-2015 to 01-27-2015) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, BY 10-01-2016. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Letter from defendant received and filed. tk

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box D277A
cf
Court calendar will begin at 10:15 on 09-21-2015. Parties have been notified, and notice of hearing have been mailed out. tk
Sentencing hearing on September 21, 2015 at 10:15 am.
Received and filed.

At the hour of 11:22 am the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read.  
" We the jury, find the defendant, Rickey Harris guilty of possessing a controlled substance, tetrahydrocannabinols, as charged in the information." 

Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  

Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction. Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 09-21-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.

Defendant Rickey J Harris in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Rickey J Harris in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Court addressed jury question. Case passed.

Court received jury question. Case recalled same appearances, defense counsel waived defendant's appearance.  
Off the record:  Sheriff's Deputies Quiles (previously sworn) and Morgan was duly sworn in charge of jury to deliberate.  

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rickey J Harris in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Rickey J Harris in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.

Trial proceeded. In court, in court officer, Ryan Dewitt. Upon questioning, Court finds the defendant knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to remain silent. Jury in the box.   Sworn for defense: Rickey Harris. Jury out of the box.  Jury in the box. Defense rests.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Jury in box.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 10:41 to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Berlin and Quiles who were duly sworn for that purpose.  

Jury questions received. Case recalled, same appearances. Off the record placed on the record. 

Jury question received. Case recalled. Jury in box at 2:11 pm. Jury out of the box at 2:31 pm. Side bar placed on the record. 

Jury question received. Case recalled. Jury in the box at 3:36pm. Court instructed the jury. Jury out of the box at 3:38 pm.

Jury question received. Case recalled. Jury in the box at 4:47 pm. Court instructed the jury and released them for the evening. Jury out of the box at 4:52 pm. Court will address jury question tomorrow.
Jury List received and filed. tk

Case recalled. Same appearances.
Juror #11 in the box. Private voir dire of Juror 11. Juror #11 out of the box. Jury panel in court.  Voir dire resumed at the hour of 1:50 pm. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed. Court instructed jury.  Opening statement made by state, defense counsel reserved the right the make an opening statement.  Jury out of box. Jury in box. Trial proceeded.  
Sworn for the state:  William Savagian, Officer- MPD. Stipulation filed.  Exhibit 1-5 received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Jury in the box.  Sworn for defense: William Savagian, Officer - MPD.  Court instructed the juror and release for the evening.  Side bars placed on the record.

Defendant Rickey J Harris in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Rickey J Harris in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  D
eputy Court Clerk: tmk.
 Parties address witness prior convictions. Parties are prepared to proceed to trial. In court officer Ryan Dewitt. Off the record discussion placed on the record.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 10:34 am. Court instructed the jurors. Jury released for the lunch hour. Jury out of the box at 11:43 am. Side bar placed on the record.
Stipulation received and filed. tk
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed. tk

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court, defendant Rickey J Harris not in court, in custody, not produced.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Final pretrial held. All discovery due by 07-27-2015 by 5:00 pm. Court will allow for entry of negotiatedplea on the day of trial, if plea forms are submitted no later than 08-03-2015 by 5:00 pm. Jury trial remains scheduled for 08-10-2015 at 9:00 am, Branch 17. Case adjourned for jury trial, branch 17.
Defense Witness List and Motion in Limine received and filed. tk
JusticePoint Pretrial Services DISCHARGE Report dated July 20, 2015 received and filed. tk
STATE PROPOSED JURY INSTRUCTIONS.
STATE'S MOTION IN LIMINE.

Defendant Rickey J Harris in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Danielle Chojnacki for Brandon Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court to address defense counsel's motion to adjourn the 8/26/2015 jury trial date. Court granted the defense request without objection of the state and ordered the jury trial scheduled for 08/26/2015 vacated. Case remains scheduled for final pre-trial on 07/24/2015 in Branch 17. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Jury trial scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Defense request scheduling date, parties notified. Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-16-2015 at 8:30 am.
MOTION TO ADJOURN.

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court, defendant Rickey J Harris not in court, in custody. Defendant produced, but not brought into Court for the purposes of scheduling.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Plea and Sentencing. Case held off the record for the purposes of scheduling.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial. Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed.  Copies given to state and defense counsel.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 7-24-2015 at 8:30 a.m., and Jury Trial scheduled on 8-26-2015 at 9:00 a.m., Branch 17. Any motions are due no later than 5-30-2015 by 5:00 p.m. and any responses are due no later than 6-13-2015 by 5:00 p.m.  Calendar call scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 05:00 pm.  Calendar call scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 05:00 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Rickey J Harris in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Danielle Chojnack on behald on Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. For reasons placed on the record, case is adjourned for plea and sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court, defendant Rickey J Harris not in court, in custody. Paul Hauer for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant produced but Defense counsel waives defendants appearance for the purposes of scheduling. Case held off the record. Case scheduled for Plea and Sentencing. For the reasons presented to the Court by the Defense, the case is adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 4-24-2015 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court, defendant Rickey J Harris not in court, in custody. Paul Hauer for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not produced. Defense counsel waives defendants appearance.
Case held off the record for scheduling purposes. Case is adjourned for Projected Plea and Sentencing on 3-27-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rickey J Harris in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Rickey J Harris in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Sergio Rentas-MPD Officer.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #14CM609 that are attached to the complaint.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by drug testing.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Rickey J Harris in court with attorney Jeffry R Schwartz.  
Defendant Rickey J Harris in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
